be.belgium.eid.event
Class CardAlivePromptTask

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      be.belgium.eid.event.CardAlivePromptTask
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class CardAlivePromptTask
extends java.lang.Thread

This class prompts the card reader to check whether the card is alive. With 'alive' we mean that the card is inserted in the card reader.

Version:
1.0.0 11 Feb 2008
Author:
Kristof Overdulve

Constructor Detail

CardAlivePromptTask

public CardAlivePromptTask(SmartCard cr,
                           CardListener cl)
Initializes the task with the given card reader. This latter is used to check whether the card is still alive. When events occur, the given listener is notified.

Parameters:
cr - is the card reader to use to prompt whether the card is in the card reader
cl - is the card listener to use to listen to changes
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Repeatably checks whether the card is currently inserted in the card reader and performs actions when the context has been changed.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

stopThread

public void stopThread()
Indicates that the thread needs to stop running.
